{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dental plaque is a biofilm or mass of bacteria that grows on surfaces within the mouth. It is a sticky colorless deposit at first, but when not cleaned the color can change to brown or pale yellow. Dextrans are polysaccharides produced by bacteria that provide the structural framework for dental plaque. They are insoluble and sticky, which allows the plaque to adhere to the tooth surface.", "answer_choice": "B"}
